data_sources.data_quality_notes: Comprehensive research conducted 2025-10-11. All data verified from utility website.

sources.description: Primary program page with current details
Additional program information and historical data

capacity_rate.payment_timing: Approximately 2 weeks after each month ends
capacity_rate.notes: Payments based on rated horsepower of pump motors. Average savings reported as $100 per pump across the summer program period.

performance_rate.notes: No performance-based payments. Fixed capacity payments only based on horsepower.

call_windows.notes: Interruptions restricted to weekdays only, no earlier than noon, no later than 9 p.m.

seasons.notes: Active months: June through August. Maximum 15 total interruptions per summer. Historical data shows only 3-4 actual interruption days per year (2019: 3 days, 2020: 4 days).

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Agricultural customers only. Must have Agriculture Water Pumping Service Tariff (AP rate schedule - APA or APB).

eligibility.minimum_usage: 64 hours per month during program months (June-August)

event_parameters.notes: Maximum 4-hour interruptions. No more than 15 total interruptions per summer. No more than twice per week. Remote controlled disconnect switch provides immediate response.

notification.notes: Program uses direct load control with remote switches. Notification requirements not specified in public documentation. Participants receive remote access to control their own pumps via web interface.

event_triggers.trigger_description: Entergy dispatches load control during peak demand periods in summer months (June-August) to manage system peak load and maintain grid reliability.
event_triggers.notes: Utility-dispatched program for peak demand management. Historical data shows conservative use: only 3-4 interruption days per year despite 15-event maximum.

nomination_bidding.notes: Direct load control program with fixed payments. No bidding or nomination required.

penalties.notes: No penalties specified. Participants can terminate participation at any time, but payments stop immediately upon termination.

technology.notes: Entergy installs remote control device at no cost to customer. Device allows both utility dispatch and customer remote control via computer, smartphone, or tablet through secure web interface. Installation and maintenance is Entergy's responsibility.

participation_terms.termination_terms: Can terminate anytime, payments stop immediately

recent_events.notes: Only 3 days with interruptions during entire summer season
Only 4 days with interruptions during entire summer season

historical_events.notes: Historical data demonstrates conservative dispatch: 3-4 interruption days per year vs. 15-event maximum allowed.

participant_satisfaction.notes: 2019 survey: 78% farmer satisfaction, 87% planned to continue participation

program_performance.notes: Program tracks individual pump enrollments based on horsepower rather than reporting aggregate MW capacity publicly.

integration_metadata.research_notes: Comprehensive program with well-documented parameters. Payment structure clearly defined with horsepower-based tiers. Event constraints well-specified (4-hour max, 15 events/summer max, 2/week max, weekdays only, noon-9pm window). Historical performance data available showing conservative dispatch (3-4 actual event days vs. 15 maximum). Technology provides dual benefit: utility dispatch capability plus farmer remote control. Only gaps: specific MW capacity enrolled, detailed notification procedures, and technical device specifications.

program_benefits: Customer retains ability to control pumps remotely via web/smartphone
Can participate with one or all pumps
unique_features: Dual-use technology: utility dispatch + farmer control
Conservative historical dispatch (high reliability for farmers)
additional_notes.target_audience: Arkansas agricultural irrigation customers with electric well pumps on Agriculture Water Pumping Service Tariff
additional_notes.regulatory_status: Approved by Arkansas Public Service Commission
